alert.note: Alert for Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:55AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Washita, northwestern Comanche, western Caddo, Jackson, southeastern Custer, Kiowa, southwestern Blaine, northwestern Tillman, southeastern Greer, west central Canadian and north central Wilbarger Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 655 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Weatherford to 3 miles south of Hobart to 3 miles southeast of Duke. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Altus, Weatherford, Hobart, Hinton, Carnegie, Snyder, Hydro, Tipton, Blair, Mountain View, Binger, Fort Cobb, Olustee, Corn, Mountain Park, Eakly, Roosevelt, Gotebo, Lookeba, and Martha. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 77 and 102. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
